abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about Second
            National Fadama Development Project (Fadama II) in Nigeria.
            Fadama is a name for irrigable land found along
            Nigeria's major river systems. The land is fertile and
            water is easily accessible, but the Fadamas have also been
            the scene of conflict among farmers, fishermen, and
            pastoralists who are vying for land, water, and grazing
            resources. The Fadama II project introduced, Local
            Development Plans (LDP) which brought resource user groups
            together in identifying the development priorities of their
            respective communities and translating these priorities into
            investment. Through community empowerment, participatory
            development planning and support for demand-driven
            productive investments in farm and nonfarm activities,
            Nigeria has boosted incomes for over 3 million farm families
            by 63 percent.
